intro: Macrolenes griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's macrolene, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and a distinctive, fragrant scent. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a deep green color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
